ygData.subject: Re: [cantera] cantera on sparc-sun-solaris
ygData.msgSnippet: Michael, One problem may be in using ~ in the prefix option to configure. I have found it necessary to use $HOME: ./configure --prefix=$HOME/cantera I

Michael,

One problem may be in using '~' in the 'prefix' option to 'configure.'   
I have found it necessary to use $HOME:

./configure --prefix=$HOME/cantera

I know that several people are successfully using Cantera on Solaris  
systems - perhaps some of you can address the specific problems.

By the way, in the new version of Cantera (already available by CVS, to  
be released 'soon' in other formats),  the Numeric package and the  
Cantera Python extension module (_cantera.so) will only be required if  
you plan to use Cantera from Python.  The process of converting .cti  
input files into XML files is now done by a single Python module that  
does not use anything from Cantera.  If you are using Cantera from  
Matlab or C++, you only need to install a single Python file  
('ctml_writer.py') where Python can find it, and do not need to build  
the rest of the Python interface.

Dave



On Jun 1, 2004, at 4:28 PM, Michael Johnson wrote:

> Dear Dave and cantera group,
>
> I am trying to install cantera in my home directory on solaris 2.9
> Python is installed on the system, and I have added Numeric-23.1 in my
> home directory, with no problem. I am able to do "from Numeric import  
> *"
> and use the Numeric functions with no errors.
>
> For cantera to even compile it was necessary to make a few changes:
>
> - set the environment varibable CC=gcc
> - modify setup.py to also look for header files in the appropriate
> Numeric directory (~/include/python)
>
> I run "./configure --prefix=~/cantera" and then "make" and "make
> install", and there are no error messages.
>
> However, when I start python this is what I get:
>
>>>> from Cantera import *
> Traceback (most recent call last):
>    File "<stdin>", line 1, in ?
>    File
> "/home/ends/johns3c/cantera/lib/python2.3/site-packages/Cantera/ 
> __init__.py",
> line 7, in ?
>      from gases import *
>    File
> "/home/ends/johns3c/cantera/lib/python2.3/site-packages/Cantera/ 
> gases.py",
> line 8, in ?
>      import solution, constants, ck2ctml
>    File
> "/home/ends/johns3c/cantera/lib/python2.3/site-packages/Cantera/ 
> solution.py",
> line 8, in ?
>      from ThermoPhase import ThermoPhase
>    File
> "/home/ends/johns3c/cantera/lib/python2.3/site-packages/Cantera/ 
> ThermoPhase.py",
> line 4, in ?
>      from Cantera.Phase import Phase
>    File
> "/home/ends/johns3c/cantera/lib/python2.3/site-packages/Cantera/ 
> Phase.py",
> line 7, in ?
>      import _cantera
> ImportError: ld.so.1: python: fatal: relocation error: file
> /home/ends/johns3c/cantera/lib/python2.3/site-packages/Cantera/ 
> _cantera.so:
> symbol _ZNSi7putbackEc: referenced symbol not found
>
> Has anyone had any experience installing cantera on solaris?
> Any ideas would be helpful.
>
> Thanks,
> Michael
